head.title: A Continuation of the Journal of the Forks Mackenzie's River for Summer 1807-1808. - Page #4

body.p: << First Page | < Previous Page | Page #4 of 50 | Next Page > | Last Page >>

td.p: Wentzel, Willard Ferdinand. A Continuation of the Journal of the Forks Mackenzie's River for Summer 1807-1808. An electronic transcription. MFTP #0022

div.p: Sad disasters it is to be feared will little contribute to our in the article of returns either of furrs or prons[.]

Wednesy 6th[.] Sent off Smith with his Indian on his return to Mr Keith[.] Sent the Latter according to request 13th Powder & 32ps Balls, with two Large Brass Kettles, one of which tho a new Kettle is Cracked in the bottom[.] Two Indians came from the R. Moun by the way of the Forks[.] Traded 2 Skins furrs & 2 in meat[.] All the Animals that way dying in great numbers[.]
Thursy 7th[.] Nothing particular occurred howed in the Potatoes, & took in a great quantity of Turnip seeds[.]
Friday 8th[.] Nothing Strange[.] Satury 9th[.] Ditto Ditto[.]

Sunday 10th[.] The Indian who had sett off with Mr Clarke having been compelled to embark much against his own inclinations, deserted and shewed himself here today – alledging as an excuse that having conveyed Mr Clarke above the Strong Current of the Grand River – he thought his help might very well be dispensed with – adding at the same time that his Gun which remained with Mr Clarke would answer for payment to another Indian if employed in his Stead – but the Rascal took good care to Steal away the Pan to serve as a firesteel – having none other[.] I asked him if he had met with ill treatment, he answered in the negative[.] [H]aving no one to fish for me and do other little works about the Fort I employed him to remain here until the arrival of the Canoes[.] So that I am not sorry at this unexpected visit Tho I am far from encouraging such Tricks[.]
Monday 11th[.] Sent the above deserter to Hunt gave him 2 meass Amn & lent him an old Second Hand Gun[.]

Tuesy 12th[.] Sent off two old men with their Famalies who have been sneaking about the Fort eight days past in hopes of obtaining a little D'Es-tlisse or Credit[.] [G]ave them two meas. Amn on Credit[.] [N]o Fish to be taken in the nets, notwithstan[d]ing that I Keep two inconstantly in the water[.]
Wednesy 13th[.] The deserter returned with two young Beavers and a Duck – besides sinking a Large Beaver, which however will make no broth[.]
Thursy 14th[.] The Old man payed me a visit again today with the meat & Skin of a moyen Bear – of which I recieved

td.p:
L E G E N D :
in red , modifications made by the editor(s).
in lavender , modifications made by the assumed author(s).
